intro: Gagea bohemica subsp. eubohemica, commonly known as the Bohemian spring beauty, is a bulbous perennial plant native to Central Europe. It produces delicate, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers in early spring. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded bulbs and is often found in moist, woodland soils. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its early blooming habit. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
